content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start in the deep jug pocket. Move up and slightly left through good holds and an undercling to the top out. There is also a cool little finger size hole at the lip that is technically on the top out but try not to break it.
content.location: The deep pocket is just left of the prominent flake on the right side of the face.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on some good unclings with feet wide . Move up through a double pocket/ pinch, a decent pocket, a slopey pocket to a deep pocket and then top out.
content.location: Look for the furthest extended down feature on low horizontal crack on left side of this face. The underclings are on either side of this feature.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on an undercling in the flake on the right side of the boulder. Move up and slightly right to the ledges. Can also be used to get back down quicker than walking around the back of the boulder.
content.location: On the right side of the face. The 2 obvious features are the large flake and the ledge.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on a slopey sidepull pinch on the right with a left hand low and go up through the jugs to Â top of the boulder.
content.location: In the middle of the face. The sloper part of the sidepull pinch is just right of a thin vertical seam which you grab for the pinch.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on a low undercling and a left sidepull. Follow the jugs up and over the top staying right of the arete.
content.location: Just right of the left arete. Feel for the good undercling by the left facing sidepull.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Starts on the right arete with a high 2 finger pocket on the arete and a low deep sidepull pocket to the left. Move up to a sloping sidepull on the arete below the lip and traverse across the face staying below the lip to a topout up through a big pocket on the left arete
content.location: Starts on the right arete of this face.
